RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Each $2,500 To $10,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPEAK OF THE DEVIL was bumped early but moved to a slim lead two deep toward the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, kept the edge over Buy Here Pay Here leaving the three eighth pole, pulled clear of that one midway on the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. ONLY GET'N BETTER raced well back toward the inside on the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths and finished well to take second the final strides. TAKE AIM was forced inward and into Speak Of The Devil shortly after the start then rated off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. BUY HERE PAY HERE raced with the pace inside, challenged the winner nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. MIMS SECOND CHANCE rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then weakened. BABY BULLDOG bore in soon after the start then settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the three path of the far turn. CAN'T STOP MAXEY showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Can't Stop Maxey
ENTRY.OWNER: A P Stable and Fox Tale Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Buy Here Pay Here
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,challenged 3/8,dropped back mid turn,flatten1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Speak of the Devil
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped early,rated slim lead,pressured 1/4,kept alert lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lady Olivia at North Cliff, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in,bumped early,off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Bulldog
ENTRY.OWNER: Rose David J and Khalaf Wadie F
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in early,off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,flattened 3p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Only Get'n Better
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,bid 7/16,4& 5p far turn,finished well,up 2nd lat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEARTNESS stalked two deep then took over toward the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure passing the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. ITS OVER exchanged contact with Political Decision leaving the gate and settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. WE B SHACKIN ducked out leaving the gate then stalked from the three path, gave chase past the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path of the far turn but was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SPUNTACULAR raced wide on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, ran evenly to late stretch then flattened later yards. CHAMBO was shuffled back after the start and rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn, left the turn outside and flattened stride. MY MIRACLE MAN rated a short lead inside, was met and gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but faded approaching the far turn. POLITICAL DECISION exchanged contact with Its Over leaving the gate then saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but showed little response. MOUNTAIN TIME rounded the opening turn about the five path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded past the five sixteenths. FOREVER THE BOSS saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but steadied passing the three eighths pole and faded from that point. MASTER YOO raced well back saving ground.

ENTRY.NAME: My Miracle Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early pace,met near 7/16,chased,faded toward far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Chambo
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back start,5p 1st turn,chased 7/16,3p far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Spuntacular
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide 1st turn,chased 7/16,4p far turn,evenly to late lane,flatten

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since February 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALPHA CHI RHO took an immediate lead and rated the pace inside, was urged away from MISSIONSNINETYNINE leaving the three eighths pole, came under pressure into the far turn and widened at the rail through the turn, dug in under steady handling in the upper stretch then taken in hand to finish the final sixteenth. The latter was brushed lightly leaving the gate then stalked two deep, gave chase into the backstretch, raced at the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. GALLANT GOLD stalked in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. ELVIRUS came away awkwardly and made contact with Missionsninetynine, raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. TOE TAPPIN LUKE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn. TRINGALE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. FIRE DOWN BELOW bobbled slightly leaving the gate and rounded the first turn about the five path, raced outside into the backstretch and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Tringale
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Missionsninetynine
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

ENTRY.NAME: Gallant Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gracie Mae Stables and Great Lake Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winner s Of A Race Since February 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPEAK YOUR MIND pressured the pace and dueled at even terms two deep into the turn, took the lead approaching the head of the lane, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn and just lasted. AKEMI bore in and made contact with Manarola on the chute then gave chase, was blocked past the seven sixteenths pole and lost momentum from that point, recovered stride outside nearing the five sixteenths, raced in the five path of the far turn, finished well and just missed. REIGN ON AND ON chased toward the inside, took aim in the three path midway on the turn, dueled through the stretch and just lasted for third. MANAROLA was bumped into COACH RUBE and squeezed on the chute then gave chase past the half mile pole, raced in the five and six paths of the turn, finished strong and just missed third. The latter was bumped on the chute then gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SPARKLE SPRINKLE gave chase then faded into the turn. COLLEGE KID set a pressured early pace, was met and dueled at even terms at the rail into the turn, but weakened past the eighth pole. HIPNOTIZADA gave chase and faded in the three path of the turn. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Akemi for interference on the chute, lodged by the rider of Manarola, and disqualified the former to fourth place for that incident.

ENTRY.NAME: College Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured early pace,met into turn,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Speak Your Mind
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,up near 1/8,just lasted driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: S S SPARTAN ENERGY settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead three wide approaching the head of the lane, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well under steady handling. MONKEY WRENCH raced with the pace three wide, challenged at the three eighths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn, took a very brief lead nearing the head of the lane but was soon caught and relented the final sixteenth. COLONIAL ROAD rounded the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, steadied in tight mid-stretch but came along for third late. COMEONTURNMELOOSE settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. JUBAY moved to the inside and rated a slim lead, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, contested even terms at the rail on the far turn then weakened past the eighth pole. SHADE TREE CORNER saved early ground and showed little response through the backstretch. WATCHING SNOW FLY raced with the early pace two deep while between horses, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p 1st turn,chased 7/16,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Jubay
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,even terms turn,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Watching Snow Fly
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace between,chased 3/8,faded rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Febr uary 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 11 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LATE IN THE GAME raced well back off the rail on the first turn, started a bid past the seven sixteenths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, lacked room entering the stretch but angled out at the eighth pole and dug in to take the nod at the wire. ALLEN CAN DO IT rated close off the rail, bid leaving the three eighths pole and dueled to even terms two deep midway on the far turn, took the nod leaving the turn, dug in under steady encouragement but was nipped at the wire. SUBJECT TO CHANGE tapered in and took over approaching the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met midway on the far turn but dug in gamely to the finish. WITH SECRET ENERGY settled off the pace about the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. UNCAPTURED KING saved ground close to the early pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep then flattened later yards. ROYAL THUNDER raced in the four path the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the four path of the far turn. SAG HARBOR raced well back inside on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. CLOSE THE CASE was shuffled back early then saved ground, gave chase into the backstretch and rounded the far turn in the four and five paths. HUMPTY GRUMPTY rated close inside, challenged toward the three eighths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sag Harbor
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,eased out 1/2,chased 3/8,6p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Humpty Grumpty
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,challenged 3/8,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,2d far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Close the Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,saved ground,chased 1/2,4& 5p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 3/8,even terms 2d mid turn,nod 1/8,nipped wire

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met mid turn,gamely to wire

ENTRY.NAME: Late in the Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,bid past 7/16,rail turn,angled out 1/8,up at wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 11 Allowed 4 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CASTLE TOY took the lead at the half mile pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. CHEROKEE CASTLE chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail, steadied from anticipated tight quarters at the rail and altered course mid-stretch but came back to finish well. DENALI D'ORO chased, raced in the four path of the turn, came along for third later yards and was gaining on the runner-up. LA MADDALENA chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, steadied mid-stretch and flattened stride. IT'S A REAL HONOR chased through the backstretch, ran near the rail on the turn then raced hemmed in through the upper stretch. NEW AGE BAD GIRL chased, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and passed rivals in the lane. BLUE MOUNTAIN gave chase, raced in range three wide on the turn but weakened from mid-stretch. LUCKY BOP gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. LET'S DO THIS chased inside but checked in tight at the rail nearing the quarter pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Cherokee Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 38700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE SEPTEMBER 11, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs . Non-winners Of A Race Since February 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO CHANGE saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the five sixteenths pole and came between horses in the three path midway on the far turn, then dug in under determined handling, matched strides late and took the nod under the wire. AUBURN MILL tapered in and rated the pace, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, was steadily encouraged leaving the far turn but missed the nod under the wire. FREEDOM RIDER rated close toward the inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, dueled through the stretch and took third late yards but lacked room nearing the wire. OUT OF CENTS rounded the first turn in the four path, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced close four wide on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. ISHIHARA stalked off the rail, challenged nearing the three eighths, raced close two deep on the far turn, then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. NEVER COMPROMISE rated close in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole then flattened off the rail on the far turn. FANCY CONCHO rounded the opening turn in the five path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn and flattened stride.

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,lacked room late

ENTRY.NAME: Out of Cents
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm Inc and G L M Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Auburn Mill
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,dug in lane,missed nod wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN FUN took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. BASHDAFLASH gave chase through the backstretch, raced close off the rail on the turn but had to settle for second. STRONG MAGIC gave distant early chase, improved at the rail on the turn and dueled through the final sixteenth for third. MY SLICK NICK chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then relented in the stretch duel for third. VASY SAYS NYET pressured the pace through the backstretch but dropped back at the rail at the quarter pole and flattened in the lane. TRICKY STRONG chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn, angled to the outside leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. MR. COWBOY BRADLEY gave chase and flattened in the three path of the turn. SPEIGHTY SENSE gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path. GEM DANCER gave close early chase, rounded the turn mostly in the three path, eased out into the lane and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant early chase,improved rail turn,dueled 3rd final 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steadily handled lane
